postProcess_tria3.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : postProcess_tria3.c                                             *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Calculates potential and electric field at the required points, and stores  *
00009 * them in files 'potential.dat' and 'field.dat'. It also calculates the force *
00010 * on the dielectric interface if required and stores it in file               *
00011 * "force-mst.dat" and "force-mp.dat" for MST and multipolar approximations    *
00012 * respectively.                                                               *
00013 * Works for linear interpolation in triangular elements (3-noded triangles).  *
00014 ******************************************************************************/
00015 
00016 /******************************************************************************
00017 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *
00018 *                                                                             *
00019 * Copyright 2006 Carlos Rosales Fernandez and The Institute of High           *
00020 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *
00021 *                                                                             *
00022 * This file is part of depSolver.                                             *
00023 *                                                                             *
00024 * depSolver is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify           *
00025 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by        *
00026 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or           *
00027 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00028 *                                                                             *
00029 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00030 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00031 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00032 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00033 *                                                                             *
00034 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00035 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00036 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00037 ******************************************************************************/
00038 
00039 #include "postProcess_tria3.h"
00040 
00041 int postProcess_tria3(unsigned int ANALYSIS, double *axis, double **XF, 
00042                       double **Xinner, double **mNodes, unsigned int **mElems, 
00043                       double **vMatParam, double *vProbParam, 
00044                       unsigned int *vBCType, double *vB)
00045 {
00046     FILE *fE,*fF,*fP;
00047     unsigned int i, nOrder, nShape;
00048     double Eps, R;
00049     double Fcm[3], mPot[2], mE[6], Xin[3], Xcm[3], Xeval[3];
00050     double **Fce, **Xce;
00051 
00052     /* Initialize */
00053     Fce = doubleMatrix(nElems,3,1);
00054     Xce = doubleMatrix(nElems,3,1);
00055     mPot[0] = mPot[1] = 0.0;
00056     for(i = 0; i < 6; i++) mE[i] = 0.0;
00057     switch(ANALYSIS){
00058         case(0):
00059             fprintf(file_log,"\n\tpostProcess_tria3(): ");
00060             fprintf(file_log,"doing potential calculation...");
00061             fP = fopen("potential.dat","w");
00062             fprintf(fP,"#x\t\ty\t\tz\t\tRe[Pot(x,y,z)]\tIm[Pot(x,y,z)]\n");
00063             break;
00064         case(1):
00065             fprintf(file_log,"\n\tpostProcess_tria3(): ");
00066             fprintf(file_log,"doing field calculation...");
00067             fE = fopen("field.dat","w");
00068             fprintf(fE,"#x\t\ty\t\tz\t\tRe[Ex(x,y,z)]\tIm[Ex(x,y,z)]\tRe[Ey(x,y,z)]");
00069             fprintf(fE,"\tIm[Ey(x,y,z)]\tRe[Ez(x,y,z)]\tIm[Ez(x,y,z)]\n");
00070             break;
00071         default:
00072             fprintf(file_log,"\n\tpostProcess_tria3(): ");
00073             fprintf(file_log,"doing potential and field calculation...");
00074             fE = fopen("field.dat","w");
00075             fP = fopen("potential.dat","w");
00076             fprintf(fP,"#x\t\ty\t\tz\t\tRe[Pot(x,y,z)]\tIm[Pot(x,y,z)]\n");
00077             fprintf(fE,"#x\t\ty\t\tz\t\tRe[Ex(x,y,z)] \tIm[Ex(x,y,z)]\tRe[Ey(x,y,z)]");
00078             fprintf(fE,"\tIm[Ey(x,y,z)] \tRe[Ez(x,y,z)]\tIm[Ez(x,y,z)]\n");
00079             break;
00080     }
00081 
00082     /* Electric field and potential values at the required points */
00083     for(i = 0; i < nInternalPoints; i++){
00084         Xin[0] = Xinner[i][0];
00085         Xin[1] = Xinner[i][1];
00086         Xin[2] = Xinner[i][2];
00087         
00088         if(ANALYSIS == 0){
00089             potential_tria3(Xin,mNodes,mElems,vB,mPot);
00090             fprintf(fP,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",Xin[0],Xin[1],Xin[2]);
00091             fprintf(fP,"%le\t%le\n",mPot[0],mPot[1]);
00092         }
00093         else if(ANALYSIS == 1){
00094             field_tria3(Xin,mNodes,mElems,vB,mE);
00095             fprintf(fE,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",Xin[0],Xin[1],Xin[2]);
00096             fprintf(fE,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",mE[0],mE[1],mE[2]);
00097             fprintf(fE,"%le\t%le\t%le\n",mE[3],mE[4],mE[5]);
00098         }
00099         else if(ANALYSIS != 4){
00100             potential_tria3(Xin,mNodes,mElems,vB,mPot);
00101             field_tria3(Xin,mNodes,mElems,vB,mE);
00102             fprintf(fP,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",Xin[0],Xin[1],Xin[2]);
00103             fprintf(fP,"%le\t%le\n",mPot[0],mPot[1]);
00104             fprintf(fE,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",Xin[0],Xin[1],Xin[2]);
00105             fprintf(fE,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",mE[0],mE[1],mE[2]);
00106             fprintf(fE,"%le\t%le\t%le\n",mE[3],mE[4],mE[5]);
00107         }
00108     }
00109     if(ANALYSIS) fclose(fE);
00110     if(ANALYSIS != 1) fclose(fP);
00111 
00112     /* Calculate Fdep at dielectric interfaces if required */
00113     if(ANALYSIS == 3 || ANALYSIS == 4){
00114         fprintf(file_log,"\n\tpostProcess_tria3(): calling forceMST_tria3() ...");
00115         fF = fopen("force-mst.dat","w");
00116         Eps = vMatParam[0][1]*eps0;
00117         
00118         forceMST_tria3(mNodes,mElems,vBCType,vB,Eps,Fce,Xce,Fcm,Xcm);
00119         fprintf(fF,"#Xcm\t\tYcm\t\tZcm\t\tFXcm\t\tFYcm\t\tFZcm\n");
00120         fprintf(fF,"%le\t%le\t%le\t%le\t%le\t%le\n",Xcm[0],Xcm[1],Xcm[2],Fcm[0],Fcm[1],Fcm[2]);
00121         fprintf(fF,"#Xce\t\tYce\t\tZce\t\tFXce\t\tFYce\t\tFZce\n");
00122         
00123         for(i = 0; i < nElems; i++){
00124             if(vBCType[mElems[i][0]-1] == 6){
00125                 fprintf(fF,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",Xce[i][0],Xce[i][1],Xce[i][2]);
00126                 fprintf(fF,"%le\t%le\t%le\n",Fce[i][0],Fce[i][1],Fce[i][2]);
00127             }
00128         }                
00129         fclose(fF);
00130     }
00131     
00132     /* Calculate Fdep at particle centre using multipolar method if required */
00133     else if(ANALYSIS > 4){
00134         fprintf(file_log,"\n\tpostProcess_tria3(): calling ");
00135         fprintf(file_log,"forceMultipole_tria3() ...");
00136         nShape = 0;
00137         switch(ANALYSIS){
00138             case 5:         /* Dipolar Approximation (Order 1) */
00139                 nOrder = 1;
00140                 R = axis[0];
00141                 break;
00142             case 6:         /* Quadrupolar Approximation (Order 2) */
00143                 nOrder = 2;
00144                 R = axis[0];
00145                 break;
00146             case 7:         /* Octupolar Approximation (Order 3) */
00147                 nOrder = 3;
00148                 R = axis[0];
00149                 break;
00150             case 8:         /* Multipolar Approx Order 4 */
00151                 nOrder = 4;
00152                 R = axis[0];
00153                 break;
00154             case 9:         /* Multipolar Approx Order 5 */
00155                 nOrder = 5;
00156                 R = axis[0];
00157                 break;
00158             case 10:        /* Dipolar Approx for Homogeneous Ellipsoid */
00159                 nOrder = 1;
00160                 nShape = 1;
00161                 break;
00162             case 11:            /* Dipolar Approx for Single-shelled Oblate Ellipsoid */
00163                 nOrder = 1;
00164                 nShape = 1;
00165                 break;
00166         }
00167         fF = fopen("force-mp.dat","w");
00168         fprintf(fF,"#Xcm\t\tYcm\t\tZcm\t\tFXcm\t\tFYcm\t\tFZcm\n");
00169         for(i = 0; i < nFPoints; i++){
00170             Xeval[0] = XF[i][0];
00171             Xeval[1] = XF[i][1];
00172             Xeval[2] = XF[i][2];
00173             if(!nShape) forceMultipole_tria3(nOrder,R,Xeval,mNodes,mElems,vB,vMatParam,vProbParam,Fcm);
00174             else forceEllipsoid_tria3(ANALYSIS, nOrder,axis,Xeval,mNodes,mElems,vB,vMatParam,vProbParam,Fcm);
00175             fprintf(fF,"%le\t%le\t%le\t",Xeval[0],Xeval[1],Xeval[2]);
00176             fprintf(fF,"%le\t%le\t%le\n",Fcm[0],Fcm[1],Fcm[2]);
00177         }
00178     }
00179 
00180     freeDoubleMatrix(Fce,nElems);
00181     freeDoubleMatrix(Xce,nElems);
00182 
00183     return 0;
00184 }
Generated on Fri Sep 1 18:45:17 2006 for depSolver v1.0 by  1.4.6
